summary: This is an email chain from June 11-12, 2020, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors discussing the drafting of the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails show the collaborative process, reference a final draft (#15), and include a request for the original Epstein complaint.

persons.name: Ilan Graff
persons.context: Appears as a recipient/copied on the email distributing the draft Maxwell indictment, indicating his involvement in the prosecution team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the indictment being drafted, referenced in the email subject and body.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in the request for the 'original Epstein complaint,' linking the Maxwell case to his prior prosecution.

connections.description: The Maxwell indictment is being drafted in relation to Epstein's case, implying their alleged criminal association.
Graff is part of the prosecution team drafting the indictment against Maxwell.

events.title: Final Draft of Maxwell Indictment Circulated
events.description: Prosecutors circulate draft #15 of the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, marking a key step before her arrest.

events.title: First Epstein Indictment Filed
events.description: Referenced by the attached file name '2019-07-01, JE, first indictment, final.docx', indicating the date of Jeffrey Epstein's initial indictment.

keyFacts: The indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was in advanced drafting stages by June 11, 2020, with a 'final draft' labeled #15 being circulated among prosecutors.
The email chain reveals internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) on the Maxwell case.
A prosecutor requests the 'original Epstein complaint,' showing the Maxwell prosecution was directly linked to the prior Epstein case.
The attached file references Epstein's first indictment dated July 1, 2019.
